node.title: 'Are we alone in the universe?': How a telescope custom-designed in Sydney could unlock the answer
node.alt: a computer generated image of a galaxy
node.description: The TOLIMAN project is aiming its finely-tuned lense across a 40-trillion kilometre expanse to find habitable planets in the neighbouring star system, Alpha Centauri.
node.content:
["Four light years is more than 40 trillion kilometres\u00a0\u2014 it\u00a0may\u00a0sound like a long way, but when you're thinking astronomically, it's just next door.", "This is the distance a custom-designed space telescope created for a joint Australian-US space mission will span as it searches for habitable planets in the neighbouring\u00a0Alpha Centauri system.", "The TOLIMAN telescope, an Arabic-derived name for the star system it'll be scanning, will utilise a diffractive pupil lense \u2014 a mirror which captures starlight to help detect the signs of habitable planets.", "Peter Tuthill from the Sydney Institute for Astronomy at the University of Sydney (USYD) said the telescope\u00a0was fine-tuned to detect rocky earth-like planets around a system's \"Goldilocks Zone\".", "Thousands of exoplanets have already been discovered outside the Solar System, but Professor Tuthill hopes there are some with liquid water\u00a0orbiting Alpha Centauri's two sun-like stars\u00a0which can sustain life.", "\"If you're too far away from your host star, you're a frozen snowball and there could be life, but it would be not-as-we-know-it,\" he said.", "\"If you're too close, you get baked. So you want that Goldilocks orbit, that just-right orbit.\"", "", "
Peter Tuthill said the telescope could answer the question, \"are we alone in the universe?\".(Supplied)
", "The system's third star, Proxima Centauri, was found to have a planet in its Goldilocks orbit in 2016.", "The TOLIMAN project began in April and is a joint scientific endeavour from Australia and NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory.", "It received seed funding\u00a0Breakthrough Initiatives in California, a $100-million suite of science programs designed to fulfil astrophysicist Stephen Hawking's dream of reaching the Alpha Centauri star system.", "At its launch in 2015, Professor Hawking said the greatest limit confronting humanity was \"the void between us and the stars.\"", "Funding for the telescope's design and construction has come from Sydney-based technology company Saber Aeronautics, which received $788,000 of federal government funding for the project.", "", "
The proposed design of the TOLIMAN space telescope.(Supplied)
", "The company will also provide operational support when the telescope is launched into orbit. Saber Aeronautics chief executive Jason Held said it was a mission Australia should be proud of.", "\"It is an exciting, bleeding-edge space telescope \u2026\u00a0it will be a joy to fly,\" he said.", "The machine will make extremely fine measurements to locate the exact position of the Alpha Centauri stars, and search for \"tiny but measurable wobbles\" to determine whether they are being orbited by a planet.", "Professor Tuthill said components for space telescope were still being ordered, but he\u00a0hoped to launch it by 2023.", "\"In order for it to deliver the science we want, it will need to be in orbit above the earth for a couple of years before we've accumulated good enough data to tell whether there's a planet in the system or not,\" the astrophysicist said.", "", "
An optical and X-ray image of the Alpha Centauri system about four light years away.(Supplied: NASA)
", "He said if a habitable planet was discovered, it could pave the way for future space exploration.", "\"Four light years is a very long way away for our present technologies but if you allow us to dream a little bit and gaze into the future several generations, maybe several tens of generations into the future, humanity's going to want to leap those voids,\" he said.", "\"We'll want to send probes over interstellar distances and get out into the galaxy... We might be able to start to answer some of these questions that have been burning for generations.", "\"Are we alone here in the universe?\""]
